author: Miranda Larbi
title: You can now get deep fried Cadbury’s Creme Eggs and they look impossibly gooey
text:
(Picture: Simpson’s Fish & Chips) Remember when the Scots started deep frying mars bars and the rest of the UK were torn between revulsion and intrigue?
Well, there’s a new Cadbury’s treat that’s getting the fryer treatment – this time in Cheltenham.
Starbucks have started 'selling organic avocado spread' and we have some questions And it’s impossibly gooey.
A chip shop is selling deep fried Cadbury’s Creme Eggs and they look absolutely incredible.
They’ll go on sale until 17 April at Simpson’s Fish and Chip Shop (which was voted the UK’s No. 1 Fish & Chips Takeaway 2016), with all proceeds from eggs sold going towards the British Hen Welfare Trust – the largest hen rescue centre in the UK.
(Picture: Simpson’s Fish & Chips) But it’s not the first time the chippy’s offered the eggstravagant snack – they tried the same thing last year.
‘Following on from the success of last year, we thought why not do it again and help raise money for another worthy cause,’ James Ritchie, Simpson’s co-founder tells Gloucestershire Live.
(Picture: Simpson’s Fish & Chips) ‘As well as rehoming over half a million hens in just six years, The British Hen Welfare Trust actively promotes British free-range farmers, which is something we fully endorse.’
And since then, they’ve had time to perfect their frying methods to reach peak crispy batter-gooey fondant levels.
‘Putting our own twist on the classic Creme Egg was great fun and we learnt last year that timing is key – frying the batter so it’s deliciously crispy and lightly warming the egg but ensuring it stays firm.
(Picture: Simpson’s Fish & Chips) ‘We’ve got it cracked though so if you’re tired of a battered sausage, come and try a battered Creme Egg.’
